record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, JUNE 4, 2007

speaking.paragraph: Madam President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 2:30 Monday, June 4; that on that day, following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, and the time for the two leaders reserved for their use later in the day; that there then be a period of morning business for 60 minutes, with Senators permitted to speak for up to 10 minutes each, and that the time be equally divided and controlled between the two leaders or their designees; that upon conclusion of morning business, the Senate resume consideration of S. 1348, the immigration legislation.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
